{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3372732,"name":null,"username":"Fricken_Chicken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/4bbf92/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-24T21:41:28.974Z","cooked":"

Now that the season is over I am looking to start a new project to keep me busy. The project is a mini swerve drive that would be driven by an esp32. My goal with this build is to have a fully functioning swerve with leftover ports for additions to the bot that I may make later on. I have been thinking about how to limit the turn motors and have landed on keeping 2 (one for each set of diagonal wheels) because all diagonal wheels stay in the same angle (180deg offsets can be done for turns). This is not a design I feel extremely good about and I want to hear your ideas.

If I understand correctly, that would theoretically work, except it would eliminate driving & spinning at the same time, or at least make it more difficult. But that‚Äôs not actually a huge issue when driving.

You should check out 9312‚Äôs turd swerve! @sthump can tell you more i‚Äôm sure but in the mean time check out their build thread that has the CAD & Code for it.

FRC 9312 NERD Spark - 2024 Build Thread Open Alliance
Week 1 has come and gone. NERD Spark has mimicked much of the rest of the OA teams‚Äô progress. i.e. built shooter and intake prototypes, talked about overall strategy. There is very little that we can add to the conversation so I‚Äôm not going to post our boring prototypes videos. I am struck by the luck of having come from FTC so recently, and having a similar game element in 2020. It was a much smaller orange foam ring but intaking and shooting required similar mechanisms. The team has revie‚Ä¶

Everything is 3D printed. All of the electronics and motors are FRC legal parts. Programmed in JAVA.

We are working on building a list of COTS parts, hardware and building instructions.

Do you have access to a 3D printer? How good are you at using CAD and specifically OnShape?

I am an inventor CADer (What my school teaches) and I would say I am proficient (I have a level 1 certification). My bigger struggle is the code because I am a beginner programmer (I have done 3-4 projects). I do have a 3d printer and use it often. I am quite curious about how the 2 modules compares to having 4 and how the bot is revolving in the center of the robot with only 2 modules.

It‚Äôs made of 3D printed parts so don‚Äôt play battlebots with it. But it will survive as a teaching tool.

Pods are pretty easy to change out. 4 bolts and the whole pod comes off and a new one can be bolted on.

In terms of slow, the motors are current limited to 20 amps or so. It will go faster if you really want it to. Not sure what you would be teaching at that point other than you can run into people‚Äôs ankles at faster speeds.

Plus faster robot looks cooler and cool thing are always good to get more students

The minimum number of pods required is 2. Adding a 3rd or 4th pod just means you need to change the math a little bit.

There are only 2 to save on costs. If you can control 2 pods, programming 3rd and 4th shouldn‚Äôt be a hard exercise.

Code is available here:

The drive motor was speed limited to 1/4 speed cuz I am a bad driver. The gear ratio is approx. L3.5 so it should theoretically be really fast. We have not tested if the PLA gears will melt or something however

Kully:

having around the neighborhood of having no money

The entire chassis has only around $80 of parts (absolute encoders, wheels, shafts, bearings, screws) if you already have the electronics

FYI,

We started a build thread specifically to record details about TurdSwerve build and programming:

TurdSwerve Build Thread General Forum
TurdSwerve is a low cost Swerve Training Platform team 9312, NERD Spark, developed in the preseason of 2023, to help our programming group get better acclimated with some of the existing code. We are going to use this thread to publish any new developments on TurdSwerve over the off season. We are collaborating with a number of teams in the coming months and hope to show some interesting things you can learn using the TurdSwerve Platform. We will be releasing a complete BOM for all of the ele‚Ä¶
